lead_paragraph: The ruling is notable because some lawmakers want to require agencies to get a warrant before searching emails for an American’s name or email address.

headline.print_headline: Judge Rejects Challenge to Searches of Emails Gathered Without a Warrant
headline.main: Judge Rejects Challenge to Searches of Emails Gathered Without Warrant

snippet: The ruling is notable because some lawmakers want to require agencies to get a warrant before searching emails for an American’s name or email address.
abstract: Federal Judge Thomas F Hogan rejects legal challenge to rules allowing FBI agents working on domestic criminal cases to search emails written by Americans and intercepted by government for purpose of gathering foreign intelligence; holds such 'backdoor searches,' initiated in 2001 under Bush administration, comply with both Constitution and FISA Amendments Act.
